title: Chomsky vs. Skinner: The Linguistics Debate of the Century
description:
The difference between Noam Chomsky's and B. F. Skinner's beliefs can be simply put as such: Skinner believes that language is learned, whereas Chomsky believes that language is innate and developed. Prof. Iris Berent elucidates how this linguistics debate is ongoing and what it tells us about language. 

Watch the full podcast episode here: https://youtu.be/y9PDvtHeDY0
